title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The response earns up to 4 points:

1 point: For an indication of conservation of energy

| Δ U | = | Δ K |

m g h = 1 2 m v 2

The speed of both blocks is v h

1 point: For substituting M/2 into the expression for U

1 point: For substituting d for h in the expression for U

1 point: For substituting the sum of the masses, M 2 + M 2 , into the expression for K

M 2 g d = 1 2 ( M 2 + M 2 ) v h 2

M 2 g d = 1 2 M v h 2

v h = g d

Alternate solution:

1 point: For an indication that Newton's second law applies

F n e t = m a

M 2 g = 2 ( M 2 ) a

1 point: For solving for acceleration

a = g 2

1 point: For selecting correct kinematics equation(s)

v 2 = v 0 2 + 2 a ( x − x 0 )  OR  x = 1 2 a t 2  and  v = a t

1 point: For substituting d for the vertical distance

v h 2 = 2 a ( d ) = 2 g 2 d  OR  d = 1 2 g 2 t 2  and  v h = g 2 t

v h = g d

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:

F g = m g

2 points: For a correct expression for the force

F g = M g L y

Note: Since the stem states “determine,” no work was necessary to earn these points.

No partial credit was awarded for this part.
descriptions:
The response earns none of the following points:

F g = m g

2 points: For a correct expression for the force

F g = M g L y

The response earns one of the following points:

F g = m g

2 points: For a correct expression for the force

F g = M g L y

The response earns both of the following points:

F g = m g

2 points: For a correct expression for the force

F g = M g L y

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For a correct integral expression for work. (If the nonintegral form of work was presented, no further work on this part was scored.)

W = ∫ F d y

1 point: For substituting F from part (b) into the integral

W = ∫ M g L y d y

W = M g L ∫ y d y

1 point: For the correct integration

W = M g L 1 2 y 2

W = M g 2 L y 2

Alternate Solution:

1 point :For a correct relationship between work and potential energy

W = − Δ U

W = m g Δ h c m

1 point :For substituting the expression for force of gravity from (b)

1 point: For substituting y/2 for Δ h c m

W = ( M L y ) g y 2

W = M g 2 L y 2

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For an indication of the work-energy relationship

W = Δ K = 1 2 m v 2

1 point: For substituting the expression for W from part (c)

1 point: For substituting M into expression for Δ K

M g 2 L y 2 = 1 2 M v r 2

v r = g / L y

Note: An alternate solution using Newton's second law and kinematics was also possible.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
The response earns up to 3 points:

1 point: For indicating that the speeds are equal

2 points: For a complete and correct justification, conceptual or symbolic

Example 1: Substituting L for d and y in the equations v h = g d and v r = g y 2 / L , respectively yields g L in both cases.

Example 2: For the blocks, a mass of M/2 falls a distance L. For the rope, the center of mass of a mass of M falls a distance of L/2 . The same amount of potential energy becomes kinetic energy. Equal total masses gaining equal kinetic energies means they acquire equal speeds.

Notes:

  • Since this part could be answered without making reference to the rest of the problem, it was scored independently.

  • A correct but incomplete justification was awarded 1 point.
